definition: (of relatives or friends) to live far apart from each other
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

square/power or involution (math.)/upright/honest/fair and square/direction/side/party (to a contract, dispute etc)/place/method/prescription (medicine)/just when/only or just/classifier for square things/abbr. for square or cubic meter

sentences.english: KARAPCHIV, Ukraine ?This is the story of two villages, half a world apart.
sentences.chinese: 烏克蘭卡拉普契夫這是天各一方的兩個村莊的故事。

sentences.english: We know we could live apart from one another.
sentences.chinese: 我們知道我們可以天各一方。

sentences.english: Lovers can undergo difficulties, but part after that.
sentences.chinese: 愛人可以風雨同舟，之後卻天各一方。

sentences.english: Though far apart, we are still able to share the beauty of the moon together.
sentences.chinese: 雖然我們天各一方，我們卻能夠共享月光的美麗。

sentences.english: For though they may be parted There is still a chance that they will see.
sentences.chinese: 即便是現在天各一方，也不見得有生之年不會再聚首。

sentences.english: Good friends, though they are so far apart from each other, their hearts are tightly closed together.
sentences.chinese: 好朋友就算天各一方，但想念的心仍是緊緊在一起的。

sentences.english: This "will to win" is what appears to separate Kobe and T-Mac.
sentences.chinese: 這種“求勝欲”使科比和麥迪天各一方。

sentences.english: Always hustle and bustle in every corner of the earth.
sentences.chinese: 天各一方的奔忙總是漫長。

definition: to go separate ways (idiom)/to part ways with sb/Taiwan pr. [ge4 ben1 dong1 xi1]
to see each other/to meet in person
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
each goes his own way (idiom); each person has his own life to lead
to leave (on a long journey)/to part from sb
destined to meet but not fated to be together (idiom)
